result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cedric Tard

records.addlTxt: Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DAN (2/25/1982)

Defendant Cedric Tard in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Cedric Tard.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
State's Bail Hearing held.  For reasons stated on the record, Court modifies no violent contact order to no contact order with victim.  Defense counsel requests pretrial conference date.  Case adjourned, Br 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Cedric Tard in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Cedric Tard.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defendant appearing in Court, Court vacates previously stayed bench warrant.  Defense counsel requests bail review hearing.  Case adjourned Br. 41.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cedric Tard not in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning appeared as a friend of the court.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for state's bail review.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Case remains calendared for Pretrial Conference on 9/30/2022 at 8:30 am.

Court ordered no violent contact order with DN (DOB 2/25/82)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Cedric Tard appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor appeared by video for Cedric Tard.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Skwierawski, Branch 41.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
